intro: Tabernaemontana chrysocarpa var. costaricensis, commonly known as the golden star beauty, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes plants known for their showy flowers and sometimes toxic properties. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars, which bloom in clusters along the branches. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
